gr.forth.ics.graph.layout
Class Logo

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.graph.layout.Logo
Direct Known Subclasses:
Logo.Drawer, Logo.Shaper
public abstract class Logo
extends Object

A utility that can ease the drawing of arbitrary shapes, via an interface similar to the Logo programming language.

Usage of this utility can avoid the need for trigonometric calculations for drawing most linear geometric shapes.

Note: All angle measures are expressed in degrees. To translate into rads, use Math.toRadians(double). This affects methods that access or change the orientation of the Logo.

The Logo starts at point (0.0, 0.0), and faces "east" (towards right). It can turn left or right, expressing angles in degrees. It can move forwards or backwards. It can "fly", i.e. thereafter it moves without actually drawing, and it can "land", i.e. it resumes drawing. (It is noted that Logos are created "landed" by default). It can reorient towards east (right), north (up), west (left) and south (down). It can also move to arbitrary locations via goTo(Point2D) and goTo(double, double).

Note that most methods can be chained, for example here is how an arrow of the form " ----->" can be drawn: Logo logo = new Logo(); logo.go(50).left(120).go(15).left(180).go(15).right(120).go(15);

public Logo goTo(Point2D point)
Relocates this drawer to the specified location, without changing its orientation. Whether a line towards there will be drawn depends on whether this drawer flies or is landed.

orientTowards

public Logo orientTowards(Point2D position)
Orients this drawer towards the specified position. That means, if the drawer moves forward, it will pass over that position, unless it is already located there. If the specified position is exactly the current position of this drawer, its orientation doesn't change.

Parameters:
position - the position to orient this drawer towards
Returns:
this

orientTowards

public Logo orientTowards(double x,
                          double y)
Orients this drawer towards the specified position. That means, if the drawer moves forward, it will pass over that position. If the specified position is exactly the current position of this drawer, its orientation doesn't change.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the position to orient this drawer towards
y - the y-coordinate of the position to orient this drawer towards
Returns:
this
